industries.description: Building infrastructure and real estate development.

industries.name: Energy

industries.name: Arts & Entertainment
industries.description: Film, music, and performing arts industries.

industries.name: Human Resources
industries.description: Recruitment, employee relations, and talent management.

industries.name: Engineering
industries.description: Civil, mechanical, electrical, and software engineering.

industries.name: Biotechnology
industries.description: Genetic research, pharma, and medical innovations.

industries.name: Cybersecurity
industries.description: Protecting systems and networks from digital threats.

industries.name: Fashion

industries.name: Fitness & Wellness
industries.description: Gyms, personal training, and health coaching.

reason_leave.reason: Career change to a different industry
Lack of growth or advancement opportunities
Desire to start a personal business
Work environment was not a good fit

software_skills.parent_skill: HR, Sales & CRM, Marketing Design Software

competencies.name: Time Management
competencies.definition: The ability to use one’s time effectively or productively.

levels.description: Manages personal deadlines effectively.
Prioritises and schedules work tasks across a team.
Optimises workflows and improves time efficiency across the organisation.

competencies.name: Technical Proficiency
competencies.definition: The ability to use technical skills or knowledge to perform specific tasks.

levels.description: Operates basic tools and follows procedures.
Applies technical skills to solve job-specific problems.
Masters and innovates with new technologies, guiding others.

competencies.name: Teamwork
competencies.definition: The combined action of a group, especially when effective and efficient.

levels.description: Collaborates effectively within a team.
Fosters team collaboration and handles conflicts.
Leads teams in complex projects, ensuring high performance and synergy.

competencies.name: Strategic Thinking
competencies.definition: The ability to think on a broad scale, involving long term planning and consideration of the implications and consequences of proposed actions.

levels.description: Understands and contributes to team strategies.
Develops strategies for specific business challenges.
Shapes and directs organisational strategy with a long-term perspective.

competencies.name: Strategic Planning
competencies.definition: The ability to outline business strategies for growth and efficiency.

levels.description: Understands basic planning principles.
Able to develop functional strategies.
Leads organisation-wide strategy formulation.

competencies.name: Self-Management
competencies.definition: The ability to prioritise goals, manage time, and maintain a positive attitude in the face of challenges.

levels.description: Manages own tasks and meets deadlines.
Sets personal goals and monitors progress.
Self-regulates effectively under high pressure, inspiring others.

competencies.name: Sales Effectiveness
competencies.definition: The ability to consistently hit or exceed revenue targets through sales activities.

levels.description: Learns product details and basic sales techniques.
Implements advanced sales strategies to meet targets.
Drives sales innovation and develops long-term sales strategies.

competencies.name: Risk Management
competencies.definition: The identification, evaluation, and prioritisation of risks followed by coordinated and economical application of resources to minimise, monitor, and control the probability or impact of unfortunate events.

levels.description: Identifies potential risks in assigned tasks.
Manages and mitigates risks in projects.
Develops risk management strategies affecting organisational goals.

competencies.name: Responsibility
competencies.definition: The duty to deal with something or of having control over someone.

levels.description: Follows directives and maintains commitments.
Proactively takes charge of roles without oversight.
Leads by example, ensuring accountability at all levels.

competencies.name: Resource Management
competencies.definition: The efficient and effective deployment of organisation’s resources when they are needed.

levels.description: Manages resources for individual tasks.
Optimises resource use for departmental projects.
Strategizes resource allocation across the organisation for maximum efficiency.

competencies.name: Resilience
competencies.definition: The capacity to recover quickly from difficulties; toughness.

levels.description: Maintains performance under stress.
Overcomes challenges and rebounds from setbacks.
Leads teams through crises, sustaining operational integrity.

competencies.name: Relationship Building
competencies.definition: The ability to establish and maintain positive and effective working relationships.

levels.description: Builds rapport with immediate colleagues.
Cultivates strong relationships within and outside the organisation.
Leverages relationships to enhance business outcomes and organisational reputation.

competencies.name: Quality Management
competencies.definition: The act of overseeing all activities and tasks needed to maintain a desired level of excellence.

levels.description: Monitors quality standards in assigned tasks.
Implements quality control processes.
Sets and enforces quality standards across the organisation.

competencies.name: Project Management
competencies.definition: The discipline of planning, organising, securing, managing, leading, and controlling resources to achieve specific goals.

levels.description: Manages small, defined projects.
Oversees larger projects with multiple stakeholders.
Directs major projects with broad organisational impact.

competencies.name: Problem Solving
competencies.definition: The ability to identify solutions to problems in effective and efficient ways.

levels.description: Addresses straightforward problems.
Solves complex problems creatively.
Develops innovative solutions to strategic issues.

competencies.name: Personal Development
competencies.definition: The commitment to improving one’s skills, abilities, and knowledge.

levels.description: Identifies areas for personal skill development.
Actively pursues learning and skills improvement.
Mentors others and drives a culture of continuous personal growth.

competencies.name: Performance Management
competencies.definition: The process of ensuring that set performance standards are achieved in a consistent manner.

levels.description: Assists in tracking performance metrics.
Manages and improves team performance.
Leads organisation-wide performance enhancement strategies.

competencies.name: Organisational Skills
competencies.definition: The ability to manage time and resources effectively to achieve desired outcomes.

levels.description: Keeps personal work area and tasks organised.
Coordinates multiple projects efficiently.
Designs and implements organisational systems on a large scale.

competencies.name: Negotiation
competencies.definition: The ability to reach agreements between two or more parties with conflicting interests.

levels.description: Negotiates simple agreements effectively.
Manages complex negotiations, achieving favourable terms.
Strategically negotiates major contracts impacting the organisation’s direction.

competencies.name: Leadership
competencies.definition: The action of leading a group of people or an organisation.

levels.description: Directs small teams or projects effectively.
Inspires and motivates larger teams, manages performance.
Visionary leadership, shapes organisational culture and strategy.

competencies.name: Interpersonal Skills
competencies.definition: The skills used by a person to interact with others properly.

levels.description: Communicates effectively in direct interactions.
Builds relationships, mediates in team settings.
Masters diplomacy, manages complex stakeholder relationships.

competencies.name: Integrity
competencies.definition: The quality of being honest and having strong moral principles.

levels.description: Adheres to workplace rules and policies.
Demonstrates ethical behaviour, inspires trust.
Upholds and champions integrity in complex scenarios, organisational ethics.

competencies.name: Initiative
competencies.definition: The ability to assess and initiate things independently.

levels.description: Takes on tasks without being told.
Seeks leadership roles in projects, suggests innovations.
Leads projects and strategic initiatives impacting the broader business scope.

competencies.name: Influence
competencies.definition: The capacity to have an effect on the character, development, or behaviour of someone or something.

levels.description: Persuades peers with direct data or authority.
Influences cross-functional teams without formal authority.
Shapes organisational strategy and external stakeholders’ perspectives.

competencies.name: Financial Acumen
competencies.definition: The ability to understand and apply financial management principles in the workplace.

levels.description: Understands basic financial terms and concepts.
Analyses financial reports and contributes to budget planning.
Strategises based on financial data to enhance business profitability.

competencies.name: Entrepreneurial
competencies.definition: The ability and desire to develop, organise, and manage a business venture along with any of its risks to make a profit.

levels.description: Identifies opportunities for improvement.
Develops new ideas and initiatives for growth.
Drives business innovation and strategic ventures.

competencies.name: Emotional Intelligence
competencies.definition: The ability to perceive, control, and evaluate emotions in oneself and others.

levels.description: Recognizes own emotions and their effects.
Manages emotions and responds appropriately to others.
Uses emotional information to guide thinking and behaviour, improves team relations.

competencies.name: Decision Making
competencies.definition: The process of making choices by identifying a decision, gathering information, and assessing alternative resolutions.

levels.description: Makes simple decisions based on clear criteria.
Makes moderately complex decisions considering various factors.
Makes strategic decisions under uncertainty, influences organisational direction.

competencies.name: Customer Service
competencies.definition: The skills needed to provide support and advice to customers effectively.

levels.description: Responds to customer inquiries.
Manages customer issues effectively.
Drives customer engagement and loyalty programs.

competencies.name: Critical Thinking
competencies.definition: The ability to analyse facts, generate and organise ideas, defend opinions, make comparisons, draw inferences, evaluate arguments and solve problems.

levels.description: Questions facts and seeks clarity.
Analyses information to form reasoned judgments.
Synthesizes and integrates new information, influencing strategic decisions.

competencies.name: Creativity
competencies.definition: The capacity to think outside the box and generate innovative ideas.

levels.description: Applies basic creativity to tasks as directed.
Develops new approaches to improve work processes.
Leads innovation initiatives, champions a culture of creativity and experimentation.

competencies.name: Conflict Resolution
competencies.definition: The ability to identify, address, and manage conflicts constructively.

levels.description: Recognizes conflicts and alerts supervisors.
Mediates conflicts directly to find mutual solutions.
Manages complex conflicts, guides others in resolution techniques.

competencies.name: Communication
competencies.definition: The capacity to convey information effectively and efficiently.

levels.description: Communicates in straightforward situations.
Communicates complex ideas clearly in group settings.
Excels in persuasive communication; influences and negotiates effectively.

competencies.name: Analytical Thinking
competencies.definition: The skill of understanding and solving complex problems through analysis.

levels.description: Identifies basic patterns and problems.
Analyses data to inform decisions.
Integrates complex data across sources; drives strategic decisions.

competencies.name: Adaptability
competencies.definition: The ability to adjust to new conditions and handle unexpected challenges.

levels.description: Reacts to change; adjusts to new tasks.
Embraces change; seeks to understand its impact.
Leads change initiatives; adapts strategy dynamically, ensuring organisational resilience.
